\section*{Figures}

%% Testing how the method can estimate natural mortality
 \begin{figure}[!ht]
     \includegraphics[scale=0.6, angle = -90]{../Results/Graphics/Estimating-NaturalMortality.ps}
      \caption{Comparison between simulated natural mortality (x-axis) and estimated using (a) a fixed number of sample each year or (b) data weighted by catch. Each panel correspond to an increasing number of samples per year varying from 1000 to 10.000.}
     \label{fig:Estimating-NaturalMortality}
   \end{figure}

%% Testing how the method can estimate catchability
 \begin{figure}[!ht]
     \includegraphics[scale=0.6, angle = -90]{../Results/Graphics/Estimating-Catchability.ps}
      \caption{Comparison between simulated catchability (x-axis) and estimated using (a) a fixed number of sample each year or (b) data weighted by catch. Each panel correspond to an increasing number of samples per year varying from 1000 to 10.000.}
     \label{fig:Estimating-Catchability}
   \end{figure}
